page.title: 08The Mitre
page.content: The Mitre is over 400 years old but several extensions and alterations have been made over the 11 years Mr Ibbottson has been there. Originally there was a cottage on the far left of the pub, in which people were living until the 1940's. This part is now part of the saloon bar. The fireplace has been knocked out and several items of interest were found behind it. Clay pipes, newspaper cuttings and an old envelope which had two postmarks on it:-Stevenage-3rd July and Witham-4th July. 50 miles in a day! An extension to the kitchen has been made, apart from that the majority of the timbers are original. Major tasks, like laying tarmac and painting the outside, are done by the brewery, while decorating the inside is done by Mr Ibbottson. He employs sixteen people.
